title: 3 Simple Ways to Change the Default Language in Wikipedia

steps.title: Create an account.
steps.content: Create an account. To change the language on Wikipedia using the website itself, you must be logged into an account where you can manage your preferences. Go to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Login and click "Create account" in the top-right corner. If you don't want to create an account, you can use Google Translate instead. Wikipedia offers translated articles in other languages. However, this doesn't apply to all existing articles. To see the available languages, go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ and click "Read Wikipedia in your language".

steps.title: Click the person icon and select Preferences.
steps.content: Click the person icon and select Preferences . You can find this in the top-right corner. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Internationalisation" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the "Internationalisation" drop-down menu. This shows your current set language for Wikipedia.

steps.title: Select a language from the list.
steps.content: Select a language from the list. Keep in mind that selecting a language other than English may show inaccurate external translations and may stop you from seeing parts of the interface properly.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This is the blue button at the bottom-left corner of the screen. Wikipedia will now be set to the assigned language.

steps.title: Create an account.
steps.content: Create an account. To change the language on Wikipedia using the website itself, you must be logged into an account where you can manage your preferences. Go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ . Tap ☰ > Log in > Join Wikipedia . If you don't want to create an account, you can use Google Translate instead. Wikipedia offers translated articles in other languages. However, this doesn't apply to all existing articles. To see the available languages, go to https://www.wikipedia.org/ , scroll down, and tap a language under Wikipedia languages .

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is at the top-left corner. A side menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Open preferences.
steps.content: Tap Open preferences . You can find this at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Tap User profile.
steps.content: Tap User profile . This is the first option.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap the "Internationalisation" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap the "Internationalisation" drop-down menu. This shows your current set language for Wikipedia.

steps.title: Select a language from the list.
steps.content: Select a language from the list. Keep in mind that selecting a language other than English may show inaccurate external translations and may stop you from seeing parts of the interface properly.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This is the blue button at the bottom-left corner of the screen. Wikipedia will now be set to the assigned language.

steps.title: Copy the URL of the page you want to translate.
steps.content: Copy the URL of the page you want to translate. You can find this in the address bar. On mobile, select the URL. Tap the URL, and then select Copy . On desktop, select the URL. Right-click, and then click Copy .

steps.title: Go to https://translate.google.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://translate.google.com/ in a web browser. You can use Google Translate in a desktop or mobile browser. Keep in mind that translations using this method may not be 100% accurate.

steps.title: Select Websites.
steps.content: Select Websites . This is at the top.

steps.title: Set the languages.
steps.content: Set the languages. Select the input language (first option) and then output language (second option). For example, if the article is in English and you want to translate it to Spanish, select English → Spanish .

steps.title: Paste the link into the field.
steps.content: Paste the link into the field. On mobile, tap the field and select Paste . On desktop, right-click the field and click Paste .

steps.title: Select the arrow icon.
steps.content: Select the arrow icon. This will send the request. A new tab should open with the translated web page. If you browse in the translated site and it reverts back to the original language, set the input and output languages again at the top of the page.
